slots.headline: Opdivo (nivolumab)
slots.subhead: Mechanism of Action and Clinical Data

slots.headline: How Opdivo Works
slots.body: Opdivo is a programmed death receptor-1 (PD-1) blocking antibody. By binding to PD-1 receptors on T cells, Opdivo blocks interaction with PD-L1 and PD-L2, releasing PD-1 pathway-mediated inhibition of the immune response, including the anti-tumor immune response.
slots.isi: IMPORTANT SAFETY INFORMATION: Severe and fatal immune-mediated adverse reactions can occur...

slots.headline: Overall Survival Data
slots.caption: Data from CheckMate trial. Results may vary.

slots.headline: Key Clinical Benefits
slots.bullets:
Improved overall survival in multiple tumor types
Durable responses in subset of patients
Manageable safety profile with immune-related adverse events
Combination therapy options available

slots.headline: Treatment Considerations
slots.column1-body: Consider PD-L1 expression status and prior treatments when selecting patients for Opdivo therapy.
slots.column2-body: Refer to prescribing information for recommended dosing schedules by indication.
slots.column3-body: Regular monitoring for immune-related adverse reactions is recommended throughout treatment.
slots.isi: Please see full Prescribing Information and Medication Guide for Opdivo.
